titles.title: Armed Forces Domestic Security Act
Armed Forces Domestic Security Act
Armed Forces Domestic Security Act
To amend title 10, United States Code, to provide for the enforcement and effectiveness of civilian orders of protection on military installations.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Armed Services.
Mr. Hayes moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 5590.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate, read twice.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Military Personnel.

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

bill.summary: 10/15/2002--Passed House without amendment. Armed Forces Domestic Security Act - Declares that a civilian order of protection (any court order issued for the purpose of preventing violent or threatening acts or harassment against, or contact or communication with or physical proximity to, another person) shall have the same force and effect on a military installation as such order has within the jurisdiction of the court that issued the order.
